metadata.name: HackTool - HandleKatz LSASS Dumper Execution
metadata.comment: Detects the use of HandleKatz, a tool that demonstrates the usage of cloned handles to Lsass in order to create an obfuscated memory dump of the same

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\loader.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--pid:')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('imphash=38d9e015591bbfd4929e0d0f47fa0055')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('imphash=0e2216679ca6e1094d63322e3412d650')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--pid:')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--outfile:')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dmp')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('lsass')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.obf')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('dump')))))

output.summary: Detects the use of HandleKatz, a tool that demonstrates the usage of cloned handles to Lsass in order to create an obfuscated memory dump of the same
